website_summaries.verdict: AMD's "refined" Polaris card trades blows with Nvidia's competing GTX 1060. It's a solid pick for 1080p gaming at high settings, or 1440p play if 60fps isn't your aim.
pros: Edged out Nvidia's competing GTX 1060 in most of our DirectX 12 tests
cons: Not much faster than Radeon RX 480, despite being larger, power-hungrier
XFX model we tested is big for a card in this class
XFX card had tricky, recessed eight-pin power connector

customer_reviews.title: Problematic
customer_reviews.text: Card started to black screen/artifact above 60-70c researched and it is a common for the RX series with the only solution to handicap the card with an underclock and undervolt. I managed to have a it stable with 100% fan speed and following a few guides from other people with the issue but will return as it is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Avoid this card at all costs! i bought it and everything went well for a while, then in the past 2 weeks it was thermal shutting off even with fans running at 100% it was running at over 95c. the card is now refusing to output any sort of signal but still runs at 100% fan speed when system is powered on. I am very disappointed as XFX used to be a great brand but now sadly they are a shadow of their former selves. once again avoid at all costs as it will cause a massive headache when return window closes!
customer_reviews.author: James B

customer_reviews.title: AVOID!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these to replace a short circuited GTX 980 - big mistake! Performance should've been on par with my 6 year old card (it was not)... Shortly after installing I was met with monitors randomly shutting off, artefacts appearing on screen, oh and best of all, the most up to date drivers from AMD produced nothing but a black screen after posting. Nightmare, as I needed this urgently as I was working from home and had no on-board graphics! I've since replaced it with a RTX 2070 SUPER, and couldn't be happier. As the saying goes, buy cheap, buy twice!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Good but has size Issues
customer_reviews.text: The top of this design sticks upwards far higher than a PCIe card should in order I think to get the big fans in. That means it will not fit some systems. On the plus side it's quieter than a lot of graphics cards I've had. Does come with a 2x6pin to 8pin connector cable for the extra GPU power which is useful.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Bought two, returned two. Looks awesome, Bad build quality
customer_reviews.text: The first time I received this GPU in the mail it was dead on arrival, so I returned it and bought another one, which had a very annoying coil whine, so I returned that one as well. I'll be buying another brand once I get my refund. Maybe Sapphire has better quality. The two redeeming things about my experience with this graphics card are the customer service from Amazon (which is nothing to do with XFX) and the way the GPU looks. It is a kickass design.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander C.

customer_reviews.title: Great card but...
customer_reviews.text: I received one with really really loud coil whine - I might have just been unlucky, however on XFX's website they claim to use low noise inductors which essentially eliminate coil whine, and for this reason I decided to return the card sadly. Bare in mind I used this in mini-ITX where it is much more noticeable - if you're building in a normal size case I'm sure this won't be an issue - the cooling is fantastic on this card, very large and quiet fans, a large aluminium backplate and copper heatpipes all round. I'm only dropping 1 star because I probably just got a bad one - solid card otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
